questions.question: The Albany Plan

choices.answer: was written by Benjamin Franklin
united the colonies for the first time
was a plan to unite the colonies to fight during the Am Rev
created a Confederacy with the Iroquois

questions.question: The economic theory of mercantilism would be consistent with which of the following statements?

choices.answer: Economies will prosper most when trade is unrestricted
A government should control the economy to maximize exports
Colonies are of little importance to the mother country
The mother country should support colonial economies.

questions.question: The French and Indian War resulted in all of the following EXCEPT

choices.answer: New lands were opened up to the colonists
Colonists began thinking of themselves as Americans
economic pressure on Great Britain
recognition to Washington for his courage and leadership

questions.question: The most effective American tactics in gaining the repeal of the Stamp and Townshend Acts was

choices.answer: Boycotting British goods
Tarring and feathering British tax agents
Sending petitions to the king and Parliament
Using death threats to intimidate British tax agents.

questions.question: Pontiac’s uprising in Detroit in 1763 was a direct cause of which of the following events?

choices.answer: The South Carolina Regulator movement
The Paxton Boys Rebellion
The Proclamation of 1763
The American Revolution

questions.question: This map showsthe western limit on colonial settlement that resulted from the

choices.answer: founding of Jamestown
Proclamation of 1763
Monroe Doctrine
Compromise of 1850

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT mandated by the Coercive Acts?

choices.answer: The port of Boston was closed
Troops would be quartered in American houses
The New York legislature was disbanded
Royal officials would be tried in England

questions.question: The Declaration of Independence contains

choices.answer: a list of grievances against the king
a plan for a new and better government
Enlightenment philosophy
arguments by Loyalist, Thomas Paine

questions.question: The day the Declaration of Independence wasapproved in 1776 is celebrated today as

choices.answer: Thanksgiving Day
Independence Day
Memorial Day
Veterans Day

questions.question: Americans who supported England after the declaration of independence were most likely to be

choices.answer: from New York
from the younger generation
from New England
wealthy

questions.question: Trapped between the French Navy and the Americantroops, Lord Cornwallis chose to surrender at

choices.answer: Saratoga
Yorktown
Bunker Hill
Lexington and Concord

questions.question: Which of the following was not a part ofthe Paris Peace Treaty ending the American Revolution?

choices.answer: The US promised to return property to loyalists
the US gained Florida
Britain recognized US Independence
The US had the Mississippi River as a western border

questions.question: The First Continental Congress was all of the following EXCEPT

choices.answer: a response to the Intolerable Acts
a meeting to figure out how to redress colonial grievances
the first National Government of the United States
responsible for calling for a Boycott of British Goods

questions.question: TheSugar Act and the Townshend Acts differed from the previously passed NavigationActs in that

choices.answer: The Navigation Acts did not apply to the colonies
The Navigation Acts were not enforced but the Sugar Act was
The Navigation Acts just taxed luxuries
The Sugar Act had higher taxes

questions.question: The main reason Great Britain established the Proclamation Line of 1763 was to

choices.answer: avoid conflicts between American colonists and Indians
make a profit by selling the land west of the Appalachians
prevent American development in the Ohio River valley
allow Canada to control the Great Lakes region

questions.question: The British gov tried to make Americans pay for British protection w all the following EXCEPT

choices.answer: the Stamp Act
the Sugar Act
the Quartering Act
the Townshend Acts

questions.question: Thejury in the 1735 trial of John Peter Zenger for the seditious libel of NewYork’s governor

choices.answer: Acquitted Zenger because his criticism was true
Declaredthat he governor could censor the press
encouragededitors to be more critical of public officials
Ruled gov't censorship of the press was unconstitutional

questions.question: The primary American objection to the Stamp Act was that it was

choices.answer: an internal tax, Americans accepted only external taxes
the first tax ever imposed by Britain on the colonies
so high that they would have crippled the colonial economy
not approved by the colonists through their representatives

questions.question: Whichof the following would be most useful in researching “Arguments for Independence”?

choices.answer: Dickinson's Letters from a Farmer in Pennsylvania
The Olive Branch Petition
John Locke's Two Treatises on Government
Thomas Paine's Common Sense

questions.question: The Quebec Act

choices.answer: outlawedCatholicism in British Quebec.
denied Quebec a representative assembly andtrial by jury.
restrictedQuebec's boundaries to north of the Great Lakes
was ignored by the colonies because it didn't effect them

questions.question: What was the main impact of Common Sense in the colonies

choices.answer: It persuaded colonists to declare independence
It reminded colonists that they owed loyalty to King George
It encouraged colonist to seek peaceful settlement w England
It convinced colonists that they couldnt win a war w Britain

questions.question: All of the following wereweaknesses of the natl gov't under the Articles of ConfederationEXCEPT

choices.answer: it lacked the power to create national taxes
it was very difficult to amend because it required unanimity
It lacked a strong executive to enforce laws
It lacked the power to create international treaties

questions.question: Shays’ Rebellion of 1786was significant because it

choices.answer: Showed the English still had influence in America
convinced many Americans we needed a stronger government
revealed the increased threat from Native Americans
revealed the flaws in the system of indentured servants

questions.question: The Great Compromisereached at the Constitutional Convention resulted in the

choices.answer: formation of the Supreme Court
creation of a bicameral legislature
development of a two-party system
ban on the importation of enslaved Africans

questions.question: The Three-fifths Compromise solved a dispute directly related to

choices.answer: the power of the president
representation in Congress
power of the Supreme Court
the addition of a Bill of Rights

questions.question: Which of the following best describes “republican motherhood”?

choices.answer: It glorified femininity and the woman’s role in the house.
It encouraged women to instill civic virtue in their sons.
It promoted the idea of separate spheres for men and women.
It led large number of middle class women to demand equality

questions.question: Which two groups debatedthe ratification of the new Constitution?

choices.answer: Loyalists and Patriots
Federalists and AntiFederalists
Democrats and Whigs
Federalists and Democratic Republicans

questions.question: The primary purpose of the Federalist Papers wasto

choices.answer: justify the AmericanRevolution to the colonists
promote the continuation ofBritish rule
encourage ratification ofthe United States Constitution
support the election ofGeorge Washington as president

questions.question: The Alien and Sedition Acts were viewed by Republicans as

choices.answer: an attack on the 1stAmendment right of free speech and press
a challenge to the power of the state governments
a necessary measure to ridthe country of illegal immigrants.
a warning to the Whiskey boys to end their rebellion.

questions.question: The Virginia and Kentucky Resolutions presented the argument that

choices.answer: states had the power to organize politicalparties
Congress had no power tolegislate on immigration
states could nullify acts of Congress
the Constitution should be amended to protect free speech

questions.question: The Democratic-Republicans favored

choices.answer: Protective Tariffs
Closer relationships with England
States' rights
a national bank

questions.question: In which area did the Federalists and Democratic-Republicans most agree?

choices.answer: Foreign Policy
Constitutional Interpretation
Economics
Indian Policy

questions.question: Alexander Hamilton’sproposal to create a national bank was criticized because it

choices.answer: a.       place too much power in the hands of Congress
a.       violate protections in the Bill of Rights
a.       increase foreign influence in the United States
a.      require a looseinterpretation of the Constitution

questions.question: Alexander Hamilton's financial program consisted of all of the followingEXCEPT

choices.answer: the creation of a U.S. bank
a.       payment of state debts by the federal government
a.      payment of subsidies tofarmers
a.       tariffs to protect developing U.S. industries

questions.question: George Washington responded to the Whiskey Rebellion in thewestern counties of Pennsylvania by

choices.answer: ignoring it until it died out
sending Hamilton to negotiate a reduced tax with protesters
calling a special sessionof Congres to deal with the problem
sending an army to put down the revolt

questions.question: In his Farewell Address, Washington warned against alliances with Europe to avoid

choices.answer: restrictions on tradewith Latin America
French colonizationof the Caribbean
United States involvement in foreign wars
invasion of the westernfrontier

questions.question: Why did Washington call up an army to crush the Whiskey Rebellion?

choices.answer: He saw the rebellion as a threat to national authority
He feared a "Reign of Terror" like France
He felt he had to protect tax collectors
He preferred leading an army to leading a national gov't
